Answer: To clear-sign a byte array using Bouncycastle PGPContentSigner, you need to use the `update` method of the PGPContentSigner to provide the data to be signed, and then call the `getEncoded` method to get the signed data and signature. Here's how you can modify your code:

```java
import org.bouncycastle.openpgp.*;
import org.bouncycastle.openpgp.bc.*;
import org.bouncycastle.openpgp.jcajce.JcePGPPrivateKey;
import org.bouncycastle.openpgp.jcajce.JcePGPSecretKeyRingCollection;
import org.bouncycastle.openpgp.operator.bc.*;
import org.bouncycastle.util.io.Streams;

...

public static byte[] clearSignBytes(byte[] dataBytes, PGPSecretKeyRingCollection skrCollection, String keyPass) throws PGPException {
    ByteArrayOutputStream baos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
    try {
        // get our secret key so we can init the signature generator
        Iterator<PGPSecretKeyRing> it = skrCollection.getKeyRings();
        PGPSecretKeyRing skr = it.next();
        PGPSecretKey skey = skr.getSecretKey();
        PGPPrivateKey prKey = skey.extractPrivateKey(new BcPBESecretKeyDecryptorBuilder(new BcPGPDigestCalculatorProvider()).build(keyPass.toCharArray()));
        BcPGPContentSignerBuilder signerBuilder = new BcPGPContentSignerBuilder(skey.getPublicKey().getAlgorithm(), PGPUtil.SHA256);
        PGPContentSigner signer = signerBuilder.build(PGPSignature.BINARY_DOCUMENT, prKey);

        // Provide the data to be signed
        signer.update(dataBytes);

        // Get the signed data and signature
        ByteArrayOutputStream signedData = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
        signedData.write(dataBytes);
        signedData.write(signer.getEncoded());

        return signedData.toByteArray();
    } catch (Exception e) {
        throw new PGPException("Exception while signing the data", e);
    }
}
```

Finally, we get the signed data and signature by concatenating the original data with the signature using the `getEncoded` method of the PGPContentSigner.

Please note that this code assumes that you have a single secret key ring in your collection. If you have multiple key rings, you will need to modify the code to handle them.

Also, please note that the `getEncoded` method of the PGPContentSigner returns the signature as a byte array, so you need to concatenate it with the original data to get the signed data.
